page.title: 02OUT & ABOUT WITH SCHOOL
page.content: It has been a busy and interesting term at Chedburgh School. The infants visited Ickworth Park for a ramble and picnic with Horringer School infants. The entire school joined with Whepstead Horringer and Chevington for a sports afternoon at Whepstead and a performance of the 'Carnival of the Animals' by King Edward VI Upper School of Bury at Horringer Community Centre. An outing to Easton Park Farm brought a sunny and enjoyable day and a mini fete a grand total of 76 pounds for P.T.A. funds. Sports Day rounded off the term nicely with the children enjoying the exercise ice cream and prizes. There is a lot of fun to be had when you go to a village school.
